Interface SolrInfoMBean

SolrCache, SolrFormatter, SolrFragmenter, SolrRequestHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
AdminHandlers, AnalysisRequestHandler, AnalysisRequestHandlerBase, BinaryUpdateRequestHandler, ClusteringComponent, ContentStreamHandlerBase, CoreAdminHandler, CSVRequestHandler, DataImportHandler, DebugComponent, DirectUpdateHandler, DirectUpdateHandler2, DisMaxRequestHandler, DisMaxRequestHandler, DocumentAnalysisRequestHandler, DumpRequestHandler, ExtractingRequestHandler, FacetComponent, FastLRUCache, FieldAnalysisRequestHandler, GapFragmenter, HighlightComponent, HighlightingPluginBase, HtmlFormatter, LRUCache, LukeRequestHandler, MoreLikeThisComponent, MoreLikeThisHandler, OldRequestHandler, PingRequestHandler, PluginInfoHandler, PropertiesRequestHandler, QueryComponent, QueryElevationComponent, RegexFragmenter, ReplicationHandler, RequestHandlerBase, SearchComponent, SearchHandler, ShowFileRequestHandler, SolrCore, SolrFieldCacheMBean, SolrIndexSearcher, SpellCheckComponent, SpellCheckerRequestHandler, StandardRequestHandler, StandardRequestHandler, StatsComponent, SystemInfoHandler, TermsComponent, TermVectorComponent, TestRequestHandler, ThreadDumpHandler, UpdateHandler, XmlUpdateRequestHandler
public interface SolrInfoMBean

MBean interface for getting various ui friendly strings and URLs for use by objects which are 'pluggable' to make server administration easier.

Version:
$Id: SolrInfoMBean.java 555343 2007-07-11 17:46:25Z hossman $

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
Simple common usage name, e.g. BasicQueryHandler, or fully qualified clas name.

getVersion

String getVersion()
Simple common usage version, e.g. 2.0

Purpose of this Class

getSourceId

String getSourceId()
CVS Id, SVN Id, etc

getSource

String getSource()
CVS Source, SVN Source, etc

getDocs

URL[] getDocs()
Documentation URL list.

Suggested documentation URLs: Homepage for sponsoring project, FAQ on class usage, Design doc for class, Wiki, bug reporting URL, etc...

getStatistics

NamedList getStatistics()
Any statistics this instance would like to be publicly available via the Solr Administration interface.

Any Object type may be stored in the list, but only the toString() representation will be used.
